newsitem.title: MEXICO: TMM-led group makes highest bid for Mexico railway.
newsitem.headline: TMM-led group makes highest bid for Mexico railway.

text.p: A group led by Mexican transport company Transportacion Maritima Mexicana SA (TMM) turned in the highest bid for the concession to operate the country's lucrative Northeast Railway, officials said on Thursday.

TMM, which teamed up with Kansas City Southern Industries Inc. for the proposal, offered 11.07 billion pesos for the concession, according to the Communications and Transport Ministry. That was well above the second highest bid of 4.272 billion by mining firm Grupo Mexico.
A third consortium led by builder ICA SA and Union Pacific Corp submitted a bid worth 4.16 billion pesos, officials said at a ceremony to open the bids.

The government has said the highest bid will win the concession as long as it is above the minimum value of the railroad established by an independent commission. It did not say, however, what the minimum level was.
Northeast Railway tracks link the capital and U.S. border with the nation's largest shipping port in Veracruz. Analysts say ownership of the railway could determine the nation's transportation king.
